page.title: 18JESUS CHURCH
page.content: Our school church is one of only two churches in the country called Jesus Church . Though closed for some three years because of serious damage by dry-rot, the church should reopen in September 1985. The building, now 150 years old, contains wooden pews and stained glass windows with pictures of Mary and Jesus. As a result of the damage, the old wooden beams have to be removed and replaced with steel trusses. The money needed, some Â£110,000, was raised by local effort. It is reckoned that less than 10% of the general population actually attend church services nowadays. When work is finished, the church will be officially re-opened by the Bishop at a special ceremonial service.
